Title: Yingi Mao’s The Everyday: Finding beauty in the ordinary
Summary: Nigerian-born, London-based artist Yingi Mao turns her gaze inward to the quiet, overlooked poetry of daily life . Her debut exhibition, titled The Everyday, opens on 2 November 2025 .

Title: Egbetokun appoints AIG Nkechi Eze as pioneer medical director
Summary: The Inspector-General of Police, Kayode Adeolu Egbetokun, has approved the appointment of Dr Nkechi Eze as the pioneer Director of the newly created Directorate of Force Medical Services . The announcement was contained in a statement signed by the IG .

Title: We will keep insurgents running – CAS Aneke
Summary: Newly confirmed Chief of the Air Staff (CAS), Air Vice Marshal Sunday Kelvin Aneke, has pledged to lead a versatile, disciplined, and intelligent Nigerian Air Force . AVM Anekes pledged to keep insurgents “running without time to think or plan”

Title: Why I chose Adamawa for my second ‘5ive’ Tour stop – Davido
Summary: Popular singer, songwriter, and record producer David Adeleke, known as Davido, has explained why he chose Adamawa State as the second stop on his ongoing 5ive Alive Tour . During his visit to the state, Davido performed in Akwa Ibom on Sunday .

Title: Bauchi creates 29 LGAs, seeks NASS’ ratification in constitution amendment
Summary: Bauchi State Government has signed a new law creating an additional 29 local government areas, while seeking the National Assembly’s approval for ratification in the ongoing constitution amendment . Governor Bala Mohammed had signed a document obtained by our Correspondent, Governor Mohammed .

Title: Police fix December 3, 4 to celebrate women in policing
Summary: Police fix December 3, 4 to celebrate women in policing . Hundeyin said the event was to mark seven decades of courage, resilience, and dedication to service . The first set of policewomen were enlisted in 1955 .

Title: Tinubu approves 15% fuel, diesel import tariff
Summary: Tinubu ordered the Federal Inland Revenue Service (FIRS) and the Nigerian Midstream and Downstream Petroleum Regulatory Authority (NMDPRA) to immediately begin enforcing the tariff .

Title: Press Freedom: Kano rejects Wole Soyinka Centre ranking list
Summary: The State's Commissioner for Information and Internal Affairs, Ibrahim Waiya, described the report as misleading, unfounded and malicious . The Commissioner described it as 'misleading, unfounded' and 'malicious' The report was published by the Wole Soyinka Centre .

Title: Indian state-backed refinery stops purchase of Russian oil
Summary: Trump has claimed that Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi has agreed to cut its Russian oil imports as part of a prospective US trade deal . New Delhi has not confirmed the deal .

Title: Photos: Three dead, several injured in multiple-vehicle crash on Lagos-Ibadan expressway
Summary: At least three persons, including a police inspector, have been confirmed dead in a multiple-vehicle crash on Kara Bridge, inward Mowe, along the Lagos-Ibadan Expressway . The Lagos State Commissioner of Police, Olanrewaju Ishola, who confirmed the incident on Thursday at the accident scene

Title: JUST IN: Eurozone growth beats expectations in third quarter
Summary: EU’s data agency said the 20-country single currency area recorded growth of 0.2 per cent over the July-September period from the previous quarter . The figure was higher than the 0.1 per cent forecast by analysts for Bloomberg and FactSet .

Title: PHOTOS: Police inspector, others die in Lagos-Ibadan Expressway multiple-truck crash
Summary: At least four persons were feared dead in a multiple-vehicle crash involving five articulated trucks on Kara Bridge, inward Mowe, along the Lagos-Ibadan Expressway on Thursday . A police inspector attached to Lagos State Police Command was said to be among the victims . Emergency response teams worked through the early hours to rescue

Title: Police dismiss viral video of bandits in Jigawa as fake
Summary: The Jigawa State Police Command has dismissed as fake a viral video purporting to show armed bandits riding motorcycles through Dutse, the state capital . The police said the footage, which sparked panic on social media, was entirely fabricated and misleading . The video, which circulated widely online, was debunked in a statement issued to journalists in

Title: Abia, firm partner to expand digital connectivity, investment
Summary: The Abia State Government and the West Indian Ocean Cable Company held a groundbreaking ceremony on Wednesday in Aba . The project is designed to expand broadband access, enhance digital inclusion, and improve last-mile connectivity across the state . Governor Alex Otti commended WIOCC for partnering with the state to drive Abia’s digital

Title: JUST IN: New Naval Chief assumes office, vows to tackle oil theft
Summary: The 23rd Chief of Naval Staff, Rear Admiral Idi Abbas, on Thursday assumed office . He pledged to intensify the fight against crude oil theft, illegal bunkering and other maritime crimes threatening Nigeria’s economy . The naval chief paid tribute to his predecessor, Vice Admiral Emmanuel Nkechukwokala .
